page.title: 15Employment
page.content: We asked the children in our school what kinds of jobs their Fathers and Mothers had. 29% of Fathers were unemployed. This was the largest percentage. 15% were miners who travelled to mines outside our block on the map. 8% were mechanics. The remaining numbers worked in a variety of jobs which included drivers, welders, bricklayers, joiners, farmworkers and factory workers. The largest percentage of Mothers were housewives _ this being 57%. 14% were machinists who worked at a clothing factory on the local industrial estate. The remainder worked in a variety of occupations which included domestic work, shop assistants, canteen assistants, nurses, secretaries and factory workers.
